page.title: 08ARMED FORCES AROUND ASHILL
page.content: Ashill being quite near several{R.A.F. bases (Watton,Swanton Morley,Marham) and{U.S.A.F.}bases (Lakenheath,Milden- hall) is regularly overflown by military aircraft.The parents of young children quite often complain about noise and danger from these low-flying planes because some children are too frightened to play outside because of the noise. The main offenders appear to be Tornadoes, Jaguars (RAF) and A10's, F111 (USAF). The village is also quite close to the{Stanford {Battle Area}(an army training ground) and it is not unusual to have loud "BANGS" shaking the house, military helicopters fly overhead and in the evenings parachute flares light up the sky to the S.W. RAF Hercules aircraft sometimes "hedge-hop" over the village before climbing rapidly over the area spilling out hundreds of{parachutists.
